Posts.Content: Hi all just me again. On Tuesday I had my pre rads appointment during which I had a ct scan. Prior to this appointment, my treatment plan was 15 rads and 5 years of letrizole. My oncologist came into scan and spoke to nurses and then I presume he went and watched the scan results as they came through as they all went into their room as the scan was done. The nurse came to me after the scan and gave me a new list of appointments and went on to tell me that my onc wants me to have a booster. This booster is adding 9 more rads to my original plan and then, when I saw my onc afterwards, he informed me that he was changing my plan of letrizole to tamoxifen for 2 years then a change of tablets. I feel stupid now because I was too scared to ask why so many boosters, not too scared to ask but scared about what answer he would of given me. When I asked when I should starting taking the tamoxifen, he just said, when you are ready, as long as its 3 weeks after your last chemo. He wants me on tamoxifen because its better for my bones than the letrozole as they can thin them. What do you think? I think this new plan is quite major , compared to my original plan. Any idea why this should happen ? Do any of you think he could of seen something on my ct scan ? Thanks all of you, Lots of love to you all Ange XX
Posts.Title: change of treatment plan after ct scan. what do you think?

Posts.Content: Thanks mistymoley for your reply but dont you think that 9 boosters is abit excessive. I thought people had between 5 and 7 days of boosters but 9, gee whizz ! Lots of love  Ange xx
Posts.Title: change of treatment plan after ct scan. what do you think?

Posts.Content: hi hawkster. I was diagnosed on 6th may this year,  through a trial of younger women. My mammogram showed up as positive in left side and consultant found something strange in right side. Bothvdiagnosed as cancer. I went into a mode where it wasn't me, it was someone else. From that moment I was scared. I have got through operation which I was petrified of. I had lumpectomy and had a wonderful experience of being in hospital. Its a real emotional roller coaster and this could tire you out. Any bad vibes that come in, push them away and let only positive thoughts wander through your mind. I canvt believe how strong I ve become!  I ve always been scared of chemo word let alone having it on a plate in front of me.everything about this scared me ! Now I m realizing how strong I am. Every step of the way, I was scared. Face it head on. There s a saying about 'do something scary, every day of your life, this is sort of like that.   I now face starting chemo on 21st july and my attitude is, lets get on with it, sooner started, sooner finished! Whatever happens, it is going to be a small part of your life compared to the rest of your life thats ahead of you. Appointments are not so good for me, I go quiet a couple of days before and for a couple of days after until it all sinks in. I also get very tired because of the emotional journey, if you are tired, then sleep.  When you go there, there is always someone worse off than you, there are children too. I even now feel so lucky, lucky that its been found, lucky that there is hope.lucky to have such support on this site, the people here are fabulous and deseverve medals. Come here with any anxieties and worries and they are there to help you through.  I wish you well and hope you come back here and remember that what you come on here for, helps someone in the future.good luck honey . Love and big gentle hugs Take care  Ange xx
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Thankyou Ed4132. No, they didnt give me anything for it, just steroids , emend and domperidone.   Strange but today, I feel nearly normal, if there is a normal again after all this! Love Ange xx
Posts.Title: lactulose ? domperidone?

Posts.Content: Thanks AmyLou1978. Thank god there s light at the end of that tunnel too ! Ange XX
Posts.Title: lactulose ? domperidone?

Posts.Content: Hi all. Had 1st fec on thursday and I think now on day 6 , my heads clearer, my bodily aches and pains have receded.  Wow, I m capable of thinking again. Strange , how when you go through the crap days, its hard to see any light at the end and you feel like its going to last forever. I do appreciate that so many of you are going through alot worse and my heart goes out to you all ! Now I know whats going to happen next time. !  BUT constipation folks! Haven t been able to go properly since thursday and not at all since saturday, is it safe to take lactulose, any idea? I ve drank loads of fluids and eaten lots of fruit but I felt like I was giving birth this morning and eventually went after being sat on toilet for an hour. Such a relief in the end!  Another thing is, Domperidone. I ve been taking it regularly since thursday and not had sickness, only waves of it coming over me. Can I stop taking these now and test the waters?   Thank you for your support Love to everyone Ange xx
Posts.Title: lactulose ? domperidone?

Posts.Content: Thanks jannie13 xx
Posts.Title: lactulose ? domperidone?

Posts.Content: Here in sheffield, none of this info has been said to me. I was even told thst sex was fine. This is quite worrrying as I have a 14 year old daughter living with my husband and myself and grandchildren that have been visiting.  I have since finished all my chemo and getting ready to start rads. To think that I could of put all my family at risk! Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: Chemo and bodily fluids

Posts.Content: Hi all. I finished all my treatment on January 6th this year and alls pretty good apart from tiredness and aches , I think from tamoxifen.  But OMG my hair, yes, thank god its growing! At the minute , in some places its about 2cm but its very uneven. The grey doesnt bother me at all ! I m wondering what to do with it as it wont style at all even with gel. Debating on getting it graded but not wanting it to come back thick. Will getting it all graded to the same length make it grow thicker? I dont want it to be thick! What did you do ? How soon after it growing did you get a haircut? I hate it at the minute. Really missing my bald head! No styling needed and it was so relaxing to run my hands over it, I loved it ! But now, its just there and depressing !  Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: hair regrowth ahhhh what to do with it ?

Posts.Content: Thanks all. Kacang - would cutting it now, make it come back thicker than ever? Why I keep saying this is that when chinese or japanese childrens hair starts to grow, they shave it off to make it grow thicker and as I have always had thick hair, I m dubious about cutting/grading it too soon in fear of it being eventually thicker than ever. But I just hate it the way it is at the moment. Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: hair regrowth ahhhh what to do with it ?

Posts.Content: Hi Sam. 1 word you used in your first post- scared ! We have all been scared at every point of diagnosis and treatment and beyond. Its understandable. I was scared of going for 1st mammogram in April, I was scared of hoing for results and I was petrified of 'chemo' even being mentioned.  I am now heading into my 4th chemo on thursday. I m still here !  Maybe not as scared, just a bit anxious every 3 weeks when it comes around again. Last operation I had was when I was 6 years old and apart from childbirth, I d never been in hospital. I am 50 now and I was soo scared of having the op BUT I got through it. I Looked at it in the beginning as a sort of adventure, not everybody, thank god, has to go through.  I hit it all head on and even did deals with hubby to have nights when the cancer word was not to be used and we used to put it out of our minds for an odd night. That was quite a task ! But we did it.  I had lymph removal on both sides, 3 from 1 side and 6 on the other. It does take quite a while to recoverbut do as they say and chill, take it easy . My nurse told me off for hoovering within the first week, I learned to do as she said. You will be sore gor a while if you need it doing BUT you will recover from it. I found the op a strange event because I felt so good after it for some strange reason and now, I d have no qualms about having another one, if ever needed. People on here are worth their weight in gold in answering any questions or worries that you have or even to help you through any tough times Good luck tomorrow, tuesday, hope all goes well. Lots of love and hugs Ange xx
Posts.Title: New to here

Posts.Content: Congratulations jjsailor for managing, pyshing through and surhiving your macmillan coffee morning. Go girl, so proud of you for doing it , you ve done right well !! Hope its not caught up with you today ! Today, rest day hun! Take care Ange xx
Posts.Title: What am I on?

Posts.Content: Thankyou for your replies. Looks like I ve got to plod on with it for a bit longer - urgh!  Yes Shirley B, i m exactly the same as you, developed a cough, yes, aches and pains and oh this tiredness - can t do nowhere near as much as i want because it comes to 4 or 5pm and i feel like i could sleep for a week! We ge got 2 horses which we drive up to feed every day. This time last year, i could pull hay bin up the field in 1 go, these days i give up. Have to have 3 or 4 breaks to get it up to the top. Its so frustrating!  Hubby has to take over with it. I just crave to feel better and this hair situ just isn t helping! A friend of mine who s also completed her treatment has dyed her hair with a semi permanent 'crazy color' dye and i ve got some but i think why bother when its got a mind of its own and is being sooo stubborn where styling is concerned. Debating whether or not to shave it all off again. But hey life goes on doesnt it ?  Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: hair regrowth ahhhh what to do with it ?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, I  was diagnosed in may, due to start chemo, then rads then letrozole. Same as you ER +. during discussion with oncologist last week, he told me that if I have a period when I start on tablets at the end of the year, then removal of ovaries or injections will have to be cosidered. This is because your cancer is ER+, this means your cancer is reliant on oestrogen to help it grow and the ovaries are where the main source of oestrogen is produced. So it makes sense that if oestrogen is still being produced by your ovaries then you are at risk of developing it again unless the source of oestrogen is taken away. For me, this would not be a problem as I am 50, but I understand if this option is distressing for you. Good luck honey, hope all works out for you. Take care Ange xx
Posts.Title: OVARY REMOVAL ER+ BC

Posts.Content: Thanks crystaljuju. Once again you ve come to my rescue!  You helped keep my head above water while I was going through chemo , july 2015 to november 2015, put me in my place occasionally to get my head back in gear. You were and still are a knight in shining armour. Bless you!  No i ve not used anything different and yes, i ve healed so well now so, it can't be healing process. Its just driving me crazy!   I will get in touch with doctor or bcn tomorrow and see what they say.  Whats this Pagets disease thing?  Do you think it could be this or is brain in overdrive - again? Thankyou for advice hun. I hope you are doing well. Lots of love and hugs Ange xx
Posts.Title: itchy nipple !

Posts.Content: Hi all. I completed all my treatment for double breast cancer back in January 2016. So, I am coming up to 18 month mark of completion. Hurray, due for mammogram in July BUT I ve got a really itchy nipple, its driving me nuts! In this breast I had a grade 3 DCIS and had lumpectomy followed by chemo, rads and boosters. The surgeon did an excellent job cutting round the line of my areola? ( think thats the correct name ) and under my arm to get to the lump. Should I be concerned about this itching? What could it be? There s no discharge just crazy itchiness.! Thanks all Sending loads of love to you all Ange
Posts.Title: itchy nipple !

Posts.Content: I think each 1 as it gets worse, it makes us a bit stronger each time but this one just broke me and I think it was sitting on loo for 3 and a half hours at 5 in the morning that broke the camels back. Its sunday today, I m so tearful and still so relieved to come through it.  At 8.30 that morning, I phoned dr in tears!  Hospital have given 2 lots of meds for constipation and nothing works. Still , dreading next 1 at end of month,  think as soon as I sit in the chair, the tears will be streaming. But, its got to be done. But oh, at moment its so good to be alive, the skies are blue in Sheffield and I ve got john denver singing, sunshine on my shoulders on my tablet. Heaven ! Hey, I m NO wimp but god , its a tough journey Love to you all Ange xx
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: Hi all. Just want to say thanks to you all for putting things into prospective last week after 3rd fec , hitting the bottom and was just feeling so crap.  At that time, we know in our heads that it will turn around but it seems like it goes on forever, 1 week seems like 3 months when you re in there. On Friday, I woke up, went to bathroom and cried with relief. I always get an epiphany moment when this happens and feel the full force of joie de vive. I love the world on these days! I love to smell the fresh air, feel the sun on my face and am very emotional, littlest things get me crying. I just love that day when it all turnsaround. Now, its upwards and onwards, ready for next one on 24th September. I joke prior to chemo with a good friend who I ve met on this site, that when we get apprehensive a couple of days before chemo, that we re going to run awaywith a tent, a case of wine and pitch up on a beach and listen to the waves all night. I m sure come the 22nd September, I ll be dreaming about that escape after this 3rd one !  So, thank you all for being there. I did it, I survived no.3!! Love hugs and strength to you all. Ange xx
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: Hey, ali owl, my fellow sheffielder! You re more than welcome to join us on that beach! The more the merrier. Could imagine all hospital staff coming in force to drag us back, kicking and screaming! We ll be needingalot more than 1 case though! Love and hugs back to you hun! take care Ange xx
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: YOU TOO ali owl, and everyone else affected by this disease  XX
Posts.Title: coming out of that dark tunnel.

Posts.Content: So, lovely Burke,  despite the fact,  that I dreaded having chemo and am now used to this crazy life of 1 in 3 weeks being good and then I ve got to have rads and me, letrozole. Starting on 3rd chemo next week of 6 and already starting with achy ankles and it sounds like life doesnt get much easier for a loooonnnnng time. I, for 1 am so sorry that you are going through this. Is there any end to this ? But we grin and bear it and know that in the end we WILL be so strong and cancer FREE. C'mon honey, be strong, it WILL end.  Its not going to be forever. Remember those bad days on chemo and when the light eventually shone through. It WILL happen again . I hope so, because I m getting ready to lean on you lot. lots of gentle hugs Love from Ange xx
Posts.Title: Joint pain update

Posts.Content: CONGRATULATIONS SHAZ65. YOU DID IT ! All cut and dried, sooo pleased for you.  Enjoy 'life' now!!!!! Huge hugs Ange xx
Posts.Title: finished

Posts.Content: Think I need that pic on my bedroom wall, dreamthief! To drag me through those dark days. Love to all  Ange xx
Posts.Title: finished

Posts.Content: I know that this wont be to everyones taste but I am thinking of having a tattoo done. The word hope and where the o is, having the breast cancer ribbon.  A year ago I had lumpectomy on both sides and had 6 lymph nodes removed on right side because of a trace of cancer in 1st node and I had 3 lymph nodes removed on left side, so I am at risk of lymphodema. Now, would a professionally done tattoo on the inside of my wrist put me at risk of lymphodema?  Is it safe for me to have 1 done, if not on my wrist then on my ankle? What do you think? Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: real tattoos

Posts.Content: Thanks all for your advice.  Marlow,  yes I do have another tat too.  But I m thinking of having it on the inside of my wrist. The chance of being diagnosed in the future is in the hands of the gods so every single day I live in hope of it never returning. Pepsicat - because I have had 3 lymph nodes removed on left side and 6 removed on right side, my BCN and doctor have told me that I have to take care of my arms for the rest of my life because I am at risk of developing lymphoedema if I ever get an infection on either hand/arm. If I cut myself I have to treat it straight away and cover it to save infection starting. Thank you all for words and advise Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: real tattoos

Posts.Content: Hi lizzy. Yes defo agree with these things growing back. While I was going through chemo and lashes fell out, I still was appling mascara and cursed everytime I poked myself in the eye with the brush! I m 5 months post treatment and most hair has grown back except under arm hair and although I ve got eyebrows, they dont need plucking but everything else is growing like wild fire! But now, doesnt it take ages to get showered or bathed and just get ready! I really miss being hair free and especially miss my bald head as my hair is driving me nuts, trying to train it again to stick down and omg the grey hairs! Just put a semi permanent dye on it and I still havent got used to it. Ahhhh! The joys. But yes, must admit, I love applying mascara now! Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: EYELASHES!

Posts.Content: What a brilliant post that just sums up our futures. I know the ' what ifs' will always try and niggle away at us if we let them, we ve just got to push them away. And they scare the life out of me! I m currently heading towards my 5th fec and then 1, just 1, left to go and then onto rads and letrizole. I m excited! But come new year my treatment will be behind me BUT I know I m not going to be be the same person who started out on this adventure in May when I was diagnosed. My hubby on day 5 after chemo expects me to be the same old Ange I was prior to May and I m no way near. People who haven t gone through this treatment just dont understand how tough it is, for gods sake, all those months of diagnosis and treatment, looking over our shoulders for the grim reaper . Is it because people dont understand how tough it is? For people to tell me that I m looking so well, I find it quite patronising and because I look well, they expect me to be acting normal when I know I m not especially in my brain, my mind, my thoughts.  Is it just going through it that makes you realuze what a life changing treatment, thought provoking adventure it is!   My hubby will expect me to be normal come January, he ll expect me to be jumping back into the old routines that I had, that I did every day and no matter how much I take time to try and explain,  I know it wont sink in. And its strange because its not sympathy I ll need, its not pity its just understanding of how hard it was and how my outlook on life will change and my prospectives on life.  There are not enough words to describe seriously how hard this journey is that ll make people understand it apart from the good people on this site who have endured it, survived it and experienced it.  Maybe I will net counselling after this! Its exciting but scary but a step into the unknown. Ange xx
Posts.Title: Getting back to "normal"

Posts.Content: Hi all,  hope everyones enjoying this warm , stormy weather. Stood outside in the stormy rain yesterday and found haviñ the rain fall on my bald head an great experience! I m now day 11 of second fec, found this rougher than the first, no energy, chronic constipation for a week, even taking regular lactulose did nt move me. Certainly going to see if doctors can give me something stronger for next time. Now, I ve got toothache, my gums and teeth have always been weak, family thing! I always end up with abcesses and worrying now that this is what will happen. Mydentist doesnt need to see me till december, so wondering if there is anything he can do. I m having a bit of a panic because if an abcess flares up my temp will go up and my whole body will feel crap. Following through with good oral hygiene, brushing, tpt brushes and mouthwashes. Mouth is realyy sore this time but got some good mouthwash off doctor to ease it. Can dentist do anything for the toothache while on chemo ?white blood cells and neutrophils were quite low when I had chemo last time but just managed to get it done. Any ideas folks? Lots of love to everyone Ange xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Thankyou Amanda for the advice. Took a big breath and shaved it all off, not wet shave as you advised. And yes, it feels so much better, not itchy anymore and it helps emotionally becsuse every time you itch, theres more on your hands and massaging it feels wonderful! These wigs are so warm in this weather. Went commando pegging washing out, constantly checking who was about,, that felt good feeling the breeze on it.yes Amanda, I m a warrioress doing battle with the enemy, and this warrioress is going to kick the enemies a××× ! Thankyou again Amanda for giving me those words that helped me through another emotional rollercoaster that is all part of this journey. Love to all Ange XX
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all, I m back needing some of your advice. Day 16 after 1st fec. Decided to have a lovely soak in bath this afternoon. Although I knew it was going to happen, washing my hair and its started, loads of it has come out. 2 nearly bald patches. Now, what to do ? I ve got visions of every time I roll over in bed tonight , getting a mouth full of it. Dare I leave it till tomorrow and risk choking on it in bed or do I now shave it all off? Another rollercoaster begins and I m shattered today because of the emotional side of it. Its been so good to feel near enough normal over the last few days, but rwady for fec 2 on thursday. For the first time, I m going to look like I ve got cancer and its a bit unnerving. Although now, on the good side, YES the chemo IS working ! Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi all. Hope everyones enjoying the weekend and the warm weather.  Had a lovely experience yesterday, standing outside in the stormy rain with my bald head. I m day 11 of 2nd fec, and found this one quite rough, no energy , chronic constipation, sore mouth and feeling just crap for a week. I think most of it is because of low white cells and neutrophils, just managed to have 2nd chemo. But now, I m starting with toothache, dont go back to dentist till december. My teeth and gums have always caused me problems, family trait! I have always had toothache then abcesses and now at this time is quite worrying because I dont want an abcess to flare up . Following through with good oral care, tpt brushes and mouthwashes as well as a rigid 2 minute brush but toothache has raised its ugly head. Any ideas folks ? Will dentist treat me if I ring him up?
Posts.Title: *** August Chemo Club ***

Posts.Content: Hi Carrie, sorry to hear that you sre going through this. Head up and be strong honey. Just because you ve got cancer does not mean  that the smiling and the laughter has to stop honey ! I had to tell my 14 year old in May andI started the converstaion with , right tell me what you know about cancer.eventually, she said, people die from it. So I then went into a positive talk about how lots of people survive from it too and then let it out that I d got it but although its going to be hard going, that I TOO WILL survive and still be her nagging and presurising here to clean her bedroom in 20 or 30 years time. She cried, she cried like a baby in my arms and I hugged her and cried with her and hubby joined in too. Just promise to be open and include your children every step of the way. I have done this with my 14 year old and my 2 sons aged 29 and 27. They have all accepted it and are always phoning me. My eldest son has moved back in to help out as he also gets on with the 14 yr old and they are good together. This is going to help us enormously when I start my chemo on thursday. Hope it goes well for you. Take care, big hugs Ange xx
Posts.Title: Telling the parents tomorrow??

Posts.Content: Back in April 2015 i was chosen as a 'guinea pig' in a new trial in sheffield to be tested by mammogram for btreast cancer in younger women. I thought about it, I laughed about it!  Eventually after alot of consideration, I went. I was sooooo lucky because I went! I ended up having double breast cancer, a grade 1 which had spread to first lymph and dcis grade 3 in other breast. If I hadn t have gone for this test at 49, by 53 there would of been no hope for me. I want to put out on facebook or whatever how important it is to go for this test whenever it comes through somebodies post. Where can I post my story that covers every avenue and can  spread my message. Thanks for your help Ange xx
Posts.Title: How to make others aware

Posts.Content: Hi all, I ve just been diagnosed on 6th may. Been living in a whirlwind for the last month. Had op on 6th June to have lump removal and had 3 lymph noees removed. Luckily for me only 1st one on both sides was positive. Is this armpit discomfort I m experiencing normal ? Will it ease ? Any ideas how else to cope with it ? Taking painkillers and ibruprofen but its just knocking the edge of it. The scars are not giving me any problem amazingly. Thought I d be in a right tangle after op but crazily, I ve felt pretty good apart from tiredness and this armpit discomfort. If I reach up for anything theres a real pulling pain there too and although theres no redness visible , there s obviously strange things going on under the skin, feels strange to touch almost numb but tingly. Will all this get better ? Thanks for reading and any advice is greatly appreciated. Sending love to all with your own struggles. X
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Thankyou all for replies, so I am normal ish. Yes I ve been doing exercises and finding them quite easy mistymoley. Its a very surreal experience this breast cancer isnt it ?
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Thanks again for your replies. This really helping to put me at ease! Jobey , is radiotherapy another uncomfortable procedure? How did that affect you? JJsailor, I wish you all the luck in the world and sending you huge gentle hugs. Bless you! I feel like I shouldnt be complaining about my little adventure when I read some of your problems, my heart goes out to you all ! I just feel so lucky. I was picked for a mammogram in our area, they re trying out a trial of younger women, thank god I was picked as the mammogram found 1 lump on my left side. While seeing the doctor and as he was examining me, very gently, he found an abnormality on the right side which turned out to be cancer as well, so thank god for his magic hands. I ve told him his hands are magic everytime I see him! Within a month I had my operation and although both sides are in early stages it had still spread to my first lymph node on both sides so imagine where I d be in 6 months or 3 years down the line while waiting for a usual mammogram appointment. So I got away with having a clear out of lymph nodes and just had 3 removed on both sides. I still wake up every morning and for a few seconds I think its a dream, then I move and realize that, yes it is happening, I then take my painkillers before I get up and go to the bathroom. I ve just got my fingers crossed for monday when I m back for my post op appointment,  I hope to god nothing else has come to light during my op. The waiting for appointments is horrible, the what ifs that always creep inside your head that you have to push away.thank you all once again for coming to my shout for advice. X
Posts.Title: breast dancer er positive

Posts.Content: Also nicky, if any cells had escaped through your nodes into your body, theyvtold me thatvthey would be microscopic and undetectable until they had settled in and started to grow because I was thinking surely blood tests or some sort of scan but no. The consultant and bcn said that this is 1 area where they have no answers as to whether cells have escaped or not. I m sure the chemo on offer is called adjuvant chemotherapy. Personally, I don t want to give this chance of growing anywhere else. A few weeks back I was scared of the biopsysies and the looming operation but I, we have done it and come through it. Then, I was petrified of them offering me chemo, it happened, I m still here! By christmas we ll be saying, god, we were petrified of this chemo and look at us now, we are still here, done it and recovering. Yes, its going to be hard but the chemo isn t going to kill us, if we dont take the bull by the horns, what could be inside of us, might ! I wish we lived near by each other and I would come and sit by you hold your hand and help you feel better by giving you support and encouagement but I can still do that with these words here, hopefully . Yes I m still scared about whats ahead but I m coming to terms with it, yes, crazy things make the tears stream but its normal. We are going through a life changing thing and have also been through that surgery which was not easy but we WILL get there. I will let you know every step what is happening to me because our course is so similar and I ll help talk you through it as much as I can when its your turn . Thinking about you. Big gentle hugs  Ange xx Hope thevtelephone call with bcn has cleared things up for you x
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: Hi Nicky. So pleased you ve come back. I was worrying about you ! So sorry to hear that you ve had the nightmare post op appointment. Defo phone your bcn, she ll relueve your worries. I ve been told yhat because your nodes are affected they could of allowed some cancerous cells through into the rest of your body,  hence the reason for chemo.even just 1 node could of allowed the blighters into your system honey. I m going alongvthe chemo route because the last thing I want is 5,7,10 years down the line if something crops up elsewhere in my body  and they say its related to my breast cancer, I would never forgive myself. As you know, I m still on a parallel course to you with tamoxifen for 10 years even after chemo and radio therapy. I have wondered if my treatment plan is too drastic but I ge got alot of faith in my consultant and he s already proved to me how good he is. Even though my lump on right sidevwas grade 1 , it had already spread to the 1 sentinel lymph node, but I m classed as grade 3 because my other lump was that grade althoughbthat one hadn t spread - very strange things these cancer lumps!   I m now 26 days post op and although I have better days, not very often but today my armpits are really painful, my right one especially where the cancerous node was. Already told it will take what seems like an age. Just keep taking paracetamol to knock the edge off it. Ivwas wondering if it is because of the heat and sweating more !  Get on the phone honey to your bcn and explain whats happened and ask her to explain you r results to you. She ll be able to explain it all, you will be going round in circles if you don't.  Take care sweetheart, big hugs. Get back on here to everybody asap so we know you're ok. And chin up, things will seem a little better when this is cleared up. XX Ange xx
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: Hiya nicky. Yes I have srarted driving again but I m not doing much because if tablets are wearing off, I still find it a bit uncomfortable. First time tired me, god, I feel such a wuss!  Just be careful with it and dont plan on driving miles!   I certainly didnt think I d still be in pain by now , if my right arm felt as good as my left, I d be sailing - not literally hun !  I m getting a right sharp pulling pain which goes from armpit to just above elbow when I stretch, there s no cording there because bcn checked it. She said it just the nerves mending and advised me to push through it. It s hard work, this mending process but we ve got to chill and believe that we re going to get better.   Whats a few months compared to a lifetime, by new year we ll both be very tired but then working mentally and physically to recover. New year, new start and we can put this horrible year behind us! Bear with it hun, its not going to be forever!  Take care and big gentle hugs  Ange XX
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: Hiya nicky. Sorry for being so long geetting back in touch, been to see my brother in wales for weekend. Fantastic getting to see them before oncologist appointment on wednesday. Apparently chemo begins a week after this appointment, where we learn a fair bit more about condition. So I needed to see my brother and his family before the onset and he lives in a village where I grew up for my first 22 years of life. Took loads of pics to get me throughrough times ahead. Quite emotional leaving them . Gosh you ve got your work cut out honey with college and all those deadlines to meet! Yes we re still on par with each other, finish chemo, onto rads and then tamoxifen, arm pain still there but only niggly on left but I m a bit more concerned about right side because that pulling pain is still there everytime I stretch it out straight but I ll see bn on wWednesday too so I ll be talking it over. I ll let you know what they do on wednesday and how it goes.  Take care  and big gentle hugs  Ange xx
Posts.Title: Post op appointment yesterday

Posts.Content: I ve just got through 2nd chemo out of 6. I ve noticed a decline in my energy. I ve really had to push myself hard to getcanything done in my home. Is this the decline ?  Is it always going to be like this ? Everytime going down and down ? Just a bit of a shock to the system this time ! Just cant imagine if I feel this crap so early what its going to he like in November. Lots of love snd gentle hugs tto every one Ange xx
Posts.Title: energy levels ?

Posts.Content: Hi mrt1975, sorry to hear your news! You both have just set foot on a roller coaster, full of ups and downs. I m newly diagnosed on 6th may 2015. During a trial where younger people were being called in . The lady doing my mammogram said, dont worry if you are called back it ll probably just be because they have no pics to compare these to. Within a week I WAS called back, me thinking it was just for more mammograms. Then she said theres an abnormality. Then the roller coaster began. A week later I was told by consultant it was cancer. On that same visit he examined me and found something 'strange' on the other side. Thst day , more tests and a week later confirmation that both sides were cancerous. My hubby was and still is a wreck. Within a month, I had my op for lump removal, there they tested lymph nodes and found the lump that consultant had found, had spread to 1st node. Had 3 rem8ved on both sides. I expected everything to happen much quicker and thouhht that by my birthday in mid july that it would all be over with. Er.... no chance! Probably finish chemo and radiotherapy by mid november and then got to go on tablets. So, it goingvto be drawn out BUT I will get through it. Hubby s brill, goes out and gets me fruit, cuts it up all ready for me and puts it in fridge to keep cool. He holds my hand at every appointment and tells me off for pushing myself too much. Your partner needs to take it easy after op. Help herbin any way you can. Household tasks etc. Its going to be hard work forvyou both but you ve proved how much you care by coming on here for advice . The people here are fantastic for advice , support and are really loving caring people. Do not hesitate to come and ask anything you or your partner want to or need to know or even to rant and scream and moan.  They all deserve medals here for their kindness and loving words. They have helped me no end.    Just be there for her, hug her and love her and let her know that she has constart support from you and people on here  no matter how her body changes. I wish you both all the luck in the world, big hugs to you both.x
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Also, your heads will be all over the place. Some of us feel like we re in a bubble. Some of us feel like its happeningto someone else until every so often we re brought back into reality. Just remember, that although it s cancer which is life changing it doesnt mean that laughter has to stop. Continue to laugh over things together and continue to love each other. Xx
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Angieknit, wondered many times how you were going on. I had last fec on 5th nov, like you. Now, I ve just started rads BUT I started on Tamoxifen on monday and I ve got the same oroblem with legs first thing in the morning. I m like a 70 year old woman hobbling out of bed! I ve found that not sitting down too much helps, always  after half hour I ll get up and walk around or make a cuppa stops legs from feeling like lead and stops this stiffness. But saying that it wont help your sensitive feet and toes. Hopefully someone who s had docetaxel will jump in and help. Good luck hun, hope you feel better soon. Love and hugs Ange xx
Posts.Title: Muscle stiffness

Posts.Content: Wow thats some good advice from you both, thankyou. Xx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen and cod liver oil

Posts.Content: Hi all. I finished treatment on 6th January and at the moment, I m trying to enjoy life again and the freedom from continuous appointments. But, theres always a but isn't there?  Apart from a horrible cough, having no where near as much energy , not sleeping well with horrid night sweats, I ve also got aches - the tamoxifen aches! Knees, ankles, fingers. God, there making me feel old although I am 50 but I m feeling like a 70 yr old,  . Has anyone tried cod liver oil capsules ? Are they safe to take with tamoxifen? Just trying to find a way of easing these aches. Been on tamoxifen since december. Any help, advice would be so appreciated. Want to enjoy life , enjoy being in and walking up fields to my horses, or even carry a hoover up stairs without it being a struggle, even walking up stairs without having to use the bannister to pull myself up. Thought after finishing treatment, life would be wonderful but it s turning out pretty crap at the minute.  Love to all Ange xx
Posts.Title: tamoxifen and cod liver oil
